Description: Handmade ceramic bowl with thick inverted rim turning sharply inward, rounded body and flat thick base. The interior is polished black and the exterior is decorated with alternate red and pale brown bands, separated by incised lines. Restored from fragments with part of the rim missing.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 14 and pl. V, 2.
